text: Kutre Dulecha (born August 22, 1978 in Sidamo) is a middle distance runner from Ethiopia. She mainly competes in 1500 metres, where she set a world junior record in 1997. She became world indoor champion in 2004, Ethiopia's first ever women's 1500 m medalist at the championships. She won the women's short course at the 2000 IAAF World Cross Country Championships. ==International competitions== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |rowspan=2|1994 |rowspan=2|World Junior Championships |rowspan=2|Lisbon, Portugal |bgcolor="cc9966"|3rd |800m |2:05.17 |- |5th |1500m |4:17.39 |- |rowspan=2|1995 |rowspan=2|All-Africa Games |rowspan=2|Harare, Zimbabwe |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |1500 metres |4:18.32 |- |bgcolor=cc9966| 3rd |800 metres |2:02.26 |- |1996 |World Junior Championships |Sydney, Australia |bgcolor=gold|1st |1500m |4:08.65 |- |1998 |World Cross Country Championships |Marrakech, Morocco |bgcolor=cc9966| 3rd |Short race (4 km) |12:37 |- |rowspan=2|1999 |World Championships |Seville, Spain |bgcolor=cc9966| 3rd |1500 metres |4:00.96 |- |All-Africa Games |Johannesburg, South Africa |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |1500 metres |4:18.33 |- |rowspan=3|2000 |World Cross Country Championships |Vilamoura, Portugal |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |Short race (4.18 km) |13:00 |- |Summer Olympics |Sydney, Australia |4th |1500 metres |4:05.33 |- |IAAF Grand Prix Final |Doha, Qatar |bgcolor="silver" | 2nd |1500 metres |4:15.75 |- |2003 |All-Africa Games |Abuja, Nigeria |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |1500 metres |4:21.63 |- |2004 |World Indoor Championships |Budapest, Hungary |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |1500 metres |4:06.40 |- |2005 |Amsterdam Marathon |Amsterdam, Netherlands |bgcolor="gold" | 1st |Marathon |2:30:05 |} ==Personal bests== *800 metres - title: Kutre Dulecha
